page.title: 06Country Churches
page.content: We have four churches in our area,and they are all Anglican.Brodsworth,Hoot_ _on,and Hickleton are all pre_Norman conquest,although the date of Marr is dubious.At the present,there are two priests in the area,Fr.G.M.Yould,who serves Brodsworth,Marr,and Hooton,and Fr.A.Parkinson,who is {priest}at Hickleton.Saxon churches were usually just a simple nave,but additions have been built on through the centuries.A {church}of the Saxon era can be found by looking for herringbone,a type of stonework,which is viewed most clearly at Brodsworth.Brodsworth{church}and Hickleton{church}both suffer from mining subsidence,which is what caused the excavations to take place at Hickleton.At every{church, worship} takes place on a regular basis,with services on Sundays and Midweek.And so {religion}is well catered for.
